title.title: Increased capacity to improve school journeys on route 463

texts: Transport for London is making some improvements to the additional schoolday services on route 463, from Monday 19 April.
The introduction of double deck buses for the extra school day journeys on route 463 will benefit local pupils and other passengers who use the service during the busy school hours
Double deck buses will operate the additional morning school journey from Coulsdon South to Beddington and the additional afternoon school journey from Beddington to Coulsdon South.
Single deck buses will continue to be used for the other journeys on the route.

Following a route test, both the morning and the afternoon double-deck journeys will run clockwise around the Clockhouse loop and they will use Hillcrest Parade instead of the easternmost end of The Mount.
The roads on the loop are St Andrew's Road, Lyndhurst Road, Winifred Road, Whitethorn Road, Hillcrest Parade and Grove Lane.
All other journeys will be unchanged.

John Barry, Head of Network Development for London Buses, said: 'The introduction of double deck buses for the extra school day journeys on route 463 will benefit local pupils and other passengers who use the service during the busy school hours.'
This improvement follows a series of recent enhancements, including a new Sunday service, an extension to Coulsdon South Station and a better service in the Pollards Hill area.
